Class MediaFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • MediaFile
  • public class MediaFile
extends Object
    Convenience class for getting input from a text file. You do not need to understand the code, but should understand the purpose of each method in this class.
    Version:
    9/15/19
    Author:
    ckinnard (Modified by STakahashi)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MediaFile()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static String readString()
      Opens a file to be used for input (if not already open), reads a line from the file, and returns the entire line of data.
      static void saveAndClose()
      Saves and closes the file (when opened for either input or output).
      static void setInputFile​(String file)
      Changes the name of the file that will be read.
      static void setOutputFile​(String file)
      Changes the name of the file that will be written.
      static void writeString​(String s, boolean newLine)
      Opens a file to be used for output (if not already open), writes a string to the file and then writes a newline.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaFile

        public MediaFile()

    • Method Detail

      • setInputFile

        public static void setInputFile​(String file)
        Changes the name of the file that will be read. There should be no spaces in the name and this method automatically appends .txt to the name.
        Parameters:
        file - the name of the file name without .txt

      • setOutputFile

        public static void setOutputFile​(String file)
        Changes the name of the file that will be written. There should be no spaces in the name and this method automatically appends .txt to the name.
        Parameters:
        file - the name of the file name without .txt

      • readString

        public static String readString()
        Opens a file to be used for input (if not already open), reads a line from the file, and returns the entire line of data.
        Returns:
        a line of text from the input file

      • writeString

        public static void writeString​(String s,
                               boolean newLine)
        Opens a file to be used for output (if not already open), writes a string to the file and then writes a newline.
        Parameters:
        s - The string text to be written. Follwing the string, a newline is added to the file.

      • saveAndClose

        public static void saveAndClose()
        Saves and closes the file (when opened for either input or output). Note: If the program terminates before the file is closed, no data will be saved or written to the file.
